results.title: Pollution
results.creator_credit: Bank of New South Wales and Kingcroft Productions
results.brief_description: Deals with air, harbour and beach pollution in Sydney, from car exhausts, chimney discharge, rubbish dumping and the disposal of sewage into the sea. This hard hitting appraisal of the situation deplores the unfortunate attitudes of people and industry to this ever increasing problem which is affecting our way of life.

results.title: Politics, power and the public good
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Searching for values: a film anthology”.
A long-term popular politician, proud of “getting things done for the people”, ruthlessly fights to retain his office with a panoply of unethical tactics and henchmen. Deeply entrenched in corruption, the politician retains his office due to the efforts of his supporters who organised a mass movement of popular support for him. Edited from the film “All the King’s Men” produced and directed by Robert Rossen.

results.title: Political, economic and social developments in the Territory of Papua New Guinea. Part 3
results.creator_credit: Neil Howe, Maslyn Williams and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: For the people of Papua and New Guinea the time when the family patch of land was the basis of society and the foundation if existence is pasing. Commercial agriculture has been introduced and opportunities of wage earning are raising living standards. Main products are copra, coconut oil, coffee and cocoa. Agricultural research stations have been established by the Administration for the benefit of both white settlers and native growers. Government Co-operative buying has been introduced and new economic opportunities have enabled the people to become partners with the Administration.

results.title: Political organization
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner, Ira R. Abrams, Coast Community College District and Holt, Rinehart and Winston
results.brief_description:
Episode number 17 of Series “Faces of culture”.
In order for societies to live together with some security for all, some form of political organisation, leadership or authority must exist. This program looks at different forms of political organisation from the bands of hunter-gatherers, through tribal systems, formal leadership, nation states and theocracies to the modern state systems with their huge bureaucracies. Narrated by David Carradine.

results.title: Polite language 1: human relations and the language
results.brief_description: The main aim of this film is to illustrate the various levels of polite, informal, and informal speech found in the Japanese language. Throughout the film many examples of greetings, leave-takings, invitations, formal and informal entertaining are shown.

results.title: Policy theories
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Economics”.
Peter Joyce of Melbourne State College presents a detailed look at economic policy including Keynesian, Monetarist, Structuralist and Supply-side theories. For each theory he considers the cause of unemployment and the policy solution; the cause of inflation and the policy solution; conclusions and the major problems of the theory. No other credits.

results.title: Police story 2 [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Jackie Chan, Leonard Ho and Golden Harvest
results.brief_description: The second of the popular “Police Story” series of films featuring Jackie Chan is considered by some critics and fans to be even better than the original. Slightly less edgy than its predecessor, ‘Police Story II’ is nevertheless packed to the brim with lightning-fast action and comic creativity. This instalment begins with Mr. Ku, the drug lord that Kevin Chan (Jackie) put behind bars in the first film, being released from prison. However, Chan’s one-man war on a criminal gang that took place in the first film, has earned him a reprimand and a demotion from detective to traffic cop. When Hong Kong is hit by a wave of bomb threats and his wife (Maggie Cheung) is kidnapped, he finds himself caught up in another private investigation. In characteristic Chan style, the film mixes mind-blowing stunts and wonderfully choreographed fight scenes that showcase his mix of grace and comic talents. In Cantonese with English subtitles.

results.title: Police powers: arrest, interview, charge, bail
results.creator_credit: John Hunter Media and Law Vision Pty Ltd
results.brief_description: Presented by Genevieve Mooy this tape follows the arrest of a woman suspected of theft and follows what happens to her at the police station, the laws that govern police powers of arrest, the interview and bail. It raises issues such as when a person can be arrested, whether a court appearance is necessary, whether the police have an obligation to inform the suspect as to why they are being arrested, warrants, the interview process, cautioning, restrictions on questioning, the right to silence and legal representation, being charged, and bail conditions and hearings. Please note: this tape was produced in co-operation with the NSW Police, so the law in other states and territories may differ substantially, although the basic elements remain the same.

results.title: Police powers. Part 2
results.brief_description: Presented by Genevieve Mooy, this video continues the story of the woman arrested for theft in Police Powers, Part 1. It tracks her progress through the legal system, focussing on her court preparation, the role of key figures in the case, including the solicitor, informant, magistrate and prosecutor, the interaction between these people during the trial, and the eventual sentencing of the defendant. Includes ten review questions at the end of the video. Please note: this tape was produced in co-operation with the NSW Police, so the law in other states and territories may differ substantially, although the basic elements are the same.
